Bio.name: Guilherme Beckman
Bio.status: Currently working as an intern at IFMS

Experience.ifmsDescription: Worked at LIADS in the infrastructure area, with the responsibility of configuring a server from scratch (on-premise), where the architecture was designed to support Microservices. To achieve this, I implemented an API Gateway using Kong, integrated with Consul as a DNS resolver to map microservice IPs, making service registration and communication easier. Additionally, I used Ubuntu Server, Docker, and Docker Compose for containerization. I also maintain existing projects, including a chatbot for the Municipality of Corumbá-MS** and software for reading and digitizing pieces of Pantanal culture.
Experience.ifmsFacialDescription: Development of a facial recognition system for access control, using Python, OpenCV, and the face_recognition library. The project involved image capture via webcam, comparison against a local database, and registration of access attempts in PostgreSQL. Tests were conducted under different lighting and angle conditions, and a technical report was produced with results and recommendations.

Projects.title: Projects
Projects.subtitle: A collection of projects that showcase my skills in web development, design, and problem-solving.

MySell.title: MySell
MySell.description: Application that helps small entrepreneurs record their daily sales. It features JWT authentication, Google and Facebook login, product and sales registration, PDF report generation, and sales history.

BirdPantanal.title: Bird Pantanal Photo Gallery
BirdPantanal.description: Explore a digital gallery dedicated to Pantanal birds, featuring articles and detailed descriptions of each species.

OrderManager.title: Online Order Management System
OrderManager.description: A microservices-based system for restaurants where customers can place orders, restaurants manage menus and order statuses, with authentication, RabbitMQ queues, and Dockerized services.

LiadsServer.title: LIADS IFMS On-premise Server
LiadsServer.description: Server developed to centralize and manage the registration of multiple Liads IFMS projects, streamlining the deployment process. It follows a microservices architecture and leverages containerization to ensure scalability and ease of maintenance.

IoTSchoolBell.title: Automated School Bell System
IoTSchoolBell.description: An IoT project to automate the school bell at SESI Corumbá-MS. Arduino with ESP8266 controls the bell, while a Python FastAPI backend with SQLite manages schedules via WebSocket/HTTP. Next.js frontend allows easy schedule configuration.

FaceRecognition.title: Facial Recognition System
FaceRecognition.description: Facial recognition system developed in Python using the face_recognition library. Captures images from a camera, processes them, and stores faces in a PostgreSQL database. Microservices-based architecture with modules in Python (recognition), Java (security), and Golang (auditing). Project currently in planning phase, with a one-year development timeline.

EcoCarona.title: Eco-Carona
EcoCarona.description: A full-stack carpooling platform built with Go and Next.js. Features user and vehicle management with CRUD operations, form validation, and a Dockerized PostgreSQL + Go + Next.js stack.

MySell.title: MySell
MySell.subtitle: Smart Sales Dashboard for Small Entrepreneurs
MySell.description: Application that helps small entrepreneurs record their daily sales. Features include JWT authentication, Google and Facebook login, product and sales registration, PDF report generation, sales history, and protection against suspicious access.
MySell.features: User Registration; User Login; Google Authentication; Facebook Authentication; Email Verification; Account Lockout after Failed Attempts; Welcome Email; Product Registration (QR Code); Product CRUD; Sales Recording and Deletion; Sales History; PDF Reports; Performance Caching; Route Protection

BirdPantanal.title: Bird Pantanal Photo Gallery
BirdPantanal.subtitle: Digital gallery of Pantanal birds
BirdPantanal.description: Bird Pantanal Photo Gallery is a digital gallery dedicated to Pantanal birds, featuring detailed articles about each species. The application allows exploring various birds with informative descriptions, providing a space to appreciate the local fauna.
BirdPantanal.features: List all birds; Retrieve specific bird data; Create new birds; Update bird data; Delete birds; Create users; Login generating a JWT token; Protect routes with JWT

OrderManager.title: Online Order Management System
OrderManager.subtitle: Microservices-based restaurant ordering system
OrderManager.description: This project is a complete order management system for restaurants using a microservices architecture. It includes authentication with JWT, user roles, order queues with RabbitMQ, MongoDB for storage, and Docker for containerized deployment.
OrderManager.features: Authentication with JWT; Role-based access control; User registration and login; Customer profile and order history; Menu and product management; Order processing with queues; Status updates in real-time; API documentation with Postman

Liads.title: LIADS IFMS On-premise Server
Liads.subtitle: Microservice Infrastructure with Docker, Kong, Consul and Nginx
Liads.description: LIADS Server is an on-premise infrastructure designed to manage multiple services with isolation, routing and health checks. It uses Docker for containerization, Kong as API Gateway, Consul as service discovery and DNS resolver, and Nginx for reverse proxy. The project aims to simplify service registration and routing inside the IFMS local network.
Liads.features: Arduino + ESP8266 Integration; Python API with FastAPI; ORM with SQLAlchemy; Migrations with Alembic; SQLite Database; WebSocket Communication; HTTP Communication; Schedule Management; Next.js Frontend; Open-source on GitHub

timeline.serviceRegistration: First services registered in Consul and routed via Kong

IoTSchoolBell.title: Automated School Bell System
IoTSchoolBell.subtitle: IoT Project developed for SESI School in Corumbá-MS
IoTSchoolBell.description: Developed in partnership with a colleague, this IoT project aims to automate the school bell, eliminating the need for manual intervention by the administration. We used Arduino with ESP8266 to control the physical device and a Python API with FastAPI, integrated with SQLAlchemy and Alembic for SQLite database persistence. The API communicates with the Arduino via WebSocket and HTTP, receiving scheduled times and triggering the bell automatically. The frontend in Next.js with TypeScript allows administrators to easily configure the bell schedule.
IoTSchoolBell.features: Hardware/software integration with Arduino + ESP8266; Python API with FastAPI; ORM with SQLAlchemy and migrations with Alembic; SQLite database; Communication via WebSocket and HTTP; Configurable scheduler for bell times; Modern frontend in Next.js; Code versioned on GitHub

FaceRecognition.title: Facial Recognition System
FaceRecognition.subtitle: Automatic face identification with microservices architecture
FaceRecognition.description: Project focused on developing a facial recognition system using Python and the face_recognition library. Images are processed, compared, and stored in a PostgreSQL database. The architecture is microservices-based, with security and auditing modules built in Java and Golang, ensuring robustness and scalability. I am leading a small team of two less-experienced developers, guiding them throughout the development process.
FaceRecognition.features: Facial recognition; Image capture; Face storage; Security module; Auditing module; Microservices architecture; Iterative development

EcoCarona.title: Eco-Carona
EcoCarona.subtitle: Sustainable Carpooling Platform
EcoCarona.description: Eco-Carona is a full-stack web application designed to promote sustainable carpooling by connecting drivers and passengers. Built with a Go backend using Gin and GORM, and a Next.js 15 frontend with TypeScript, TailwindCSS, and Shadcn UI components. The application features complete user and vehicle management with a clean layered architecture.
EcoCarona.features: User management with CPF validation; Vehicle registration with detailed specs; Interactive data tables with edit/delete; Form validation with Zod and React Hook Form; RESTful API with Go and Gin; Shift/schedule management; Dockerized full-stack deployment; Responsive design with TailwindCSS

timeline.backendSetup: Backend setup with Go, Gin, GORM, and PostgreSQL
timeline.apiImplementation: REST API implementation for users and cars
timeline.nextjsUI: Next.js 15 frontend with Shadcn UI and form validation
